definition: to capsize/(fig.) to suffer a setback or defeat
to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross
boat/vessel/ship/CL:條|条[tiao2],艘[sou1],隻|只[zhi1]
to meet with unexpected failure (idiom)/to fail miserably (where failure was not expected)

sentences.english: He spent around an hour rowing across the river, and also, his boat almost turned over for twice.
sentences.chinese: 他花了約一個小時划船過河，其間有兩次幾乎翻船。

sentences.english: As a shipwrecked sailor hates the sea.
sentences.chinese: 如翻船的水手望洋生怨。

sentences.english: This season superior Luneng also has the sewer capsizes the experience.
sentences.chinese: 本賽季中超魯能還有着“陰溝翻船”的經歷。

sentences.english: Boat capsize kills dozens of stowaways enroute to US.
sentences.chinese: 偷渡美國途中翻船，福建數十人喪生。

sentences.english: Wave hit the ship,and  Mignonette went down.
sentences.chinese: 大浪導致翻船，“木犀草號“沉沒。

sentences.english: Authorities say bad weather may have caused the vessel to overturn.
sentences.chinese: 有關當局說，惡劣天氣可能導致此次翻船。

sentences.english: The vessel capsized off the coast of Florida killing at least 9 people.
sentences.chinese: 這艘船在福羅裏達海岸翻船，此次事件至少死亡9人。

sentences.english: If you're afraid of capsizing, your tacks will be mediocre.
sentences.chinese: 如果您怕翻船，您的大頭針將平庸。

sentences.english: The result will be to capsize yet more small businesses.
sentences.chinese: 其結果將是翻船更多的小企業。

definition: (of a ship) to strike a reef/(fig.) to hit a snag
to meet with unexpected failure (idiom)/to fail miserably (where failure was not expected)
to capsize and sink
lit. to be buried in the bellies of fish (idiom)/fig. to drown
wind and waves/stormy sea
to fall head over heels/(fig.) to come a cropper
to drown
lit. the horse loses its front hooves/fig. sudden failure through miscalculation or inattentiveness
to abandon ship
to escape unscathed/to get through in one piece
annihilated/capsized
to fall into water/to sink/overboard/fig. to degenerate/to sink (into depravity)/to go to the dogs
to drown
to drop anchor/to break down (of a car etc)
to get into difficulties/to meet with danger
to lose one's footing/to slip/to take a wrong step in life
